Got a Question
All degrees are Bologna compliant. Undergraduate degree programmes at the UAD consist of four stages (for a full-time student a ‘stage’ is one academic year) of study:
• Stage One (Semesters 1 & 2) leads to a Certificate of Higher Education
• Stage Two (Semesters 3 & 4) leads to a Diploma of Higher Education
• Stage Three (Semesters 5 & 6) leads to a Bachelors Degree
• Stage Four (Semesters 7 & 8) leads to a Bachelors Degree with Honours.
EU Articulation Scheme students can study Stage Two
column2: Three or Four.  Students must therefore have successfully completed
column4: the equivalent modules for semesters 1 to 2 (for Stage Two entry)
column5: 1 to 4 (for stage three entry) or 1 to 6 (for stage four entry).

column1: A wide range of degree programmes available to EU students within the EU Articulation Scheme. Details of the degree Structures can be found on the separate sheets and syllabus content can be found within the password-protected area of the University’s web site.
